books.description: The Academy Award-winning actor shares snippets from the diaries he kept over the last 35 years. Read by the author. 6 hours, 42 minutes unabridged.
books.title: GREENLIGHTS

books.author: Molly Shannon with Sean Wilsey
books.contributor: by Molly Shannon with Sean Wilsey
books.description: The comedic actor shares stories of family tragedy and her years as a star of “Saturday Night Live.” Read by Molly Shannon. 7 hours, 5 minutes unabridged.
books.title: HELLO, MOLLY!

books.author: Bessel van der Kolk
books.description: How trauma affects the body and mind, and innovative treatments for recovery. Read by Sean Pratt. 16 hours, 17 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE BODY KEEPS THE SCORE

books.author: Susan Cain
books.description: The author of “Quiet” suggests ways to embrace loss and suffering within ourselves and others. Read by the author. 7 hours, 35 minutes unabridged.
books.title: BITTERSWEET

books.author: Bill Browder
books.description: The author of “Red Notice” tells his story of becoming Vladimir Putin’s enemy by uncovering a $230 million tax refund scheme. Read by Adam Grupper. 10 hours, 29 minutes unabridged.
books.title: FREEZING ORDER

books.author: Will Smith with Mark Manson
books.contributor: by Will Smith with Mark Manson
books.description: The actor, producer and musician tells his life story and lessons he learned along the way. Read by Will Smith. 16 hours, 16 minutes unabridged.
books.title: WILL

books.author: Jocko Willink and Leif Babin
books.contributor: by Jocko Willink and Leif Babin
books.description: Applying the principles of Navy SEALs leadership training to any organization. Read by the authors. 8 hours, 15 minutes unabridged.
books.title: EXTREME OWNERSHIP

books.author: Dave Grohl
books.description: A memoir by the musician known for his work with Foo Fighters and Nirvana. Read by the author. 10 hours, 35 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE STORYTELLER

books.author: Laura Clery
books.description: The social media influencer shares observations on motherhood and marriage. Read by the author. 8 hours, 16 minutes unabridged.
books.title: IDIOTS

books.author: Bruce D. Perry and Oprah Winfrey
books.contributor: by Bruce D. Perry and Oprah Winfrey
books.description: An approach to dealing with trauma that shifts an essential question used to investigate it. Read by the authors. 8 hours, 27 minutes unabridged.
books.title: WHAT HAPPENED TO YOU?

books.author: Anna Lembke
books.description: The medical director of Stanford Addiction Medicine explores the neuroscience and behaviors that inform the relationship between pleasure and pain. Read by the author. 6 hours, 11 minutes unabridged.
books.title: DOPAMINE NATION

books.author: David Mamet
books.description: The Pulitzer Prize-winning playwright lambastes liberal politics, cancel culture and other things he finds objectionable. Read by Jim Frangione. 6 hours, 20 minutes unabridged.
books.title: RECESSIONAL

books.author: Douglas Murray
books.description: An associate editor of The Spectator and Fox News contributor makes his arguments against anti-Western rhetoric. Read by the author. 12 hours, 42 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE WAR ON THE WEST

books.author: Tina Brown
books.description: This follow-up to “The Diana Chronicles” details how the royal family reinvented itself after the death of Princess Diana. Read by the author. 17 hours, 56 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE PALACE PAPERS

books.author: Ray Dalio
books.title: PRINCIPLES FOR DEALING WITH THE CHANGING WORLD ORDER

books.author: Jocko Willink and Leif Babin

books.description: The third book in the Cat Kid Comic Club series. Fame, fortune and creativity pull the members of the comic club in different directions.

books.description: Denji seeks help from Makima to overcome his lack of motivation but might be inviting more pain.
books.title: CHAINSAW MAN VOL. 10

books.description: Itadori struggles to help Kugisaki, who has fallen into Mahito’s trap.

books.description: The second book in the Cat Kid Comic Club series. Can this cast of characters understand and appreciate one another’s point of view?

books.description: Twilight interrupts a rare family moment between Donovan Desmond and his son Damian.

books.description: When Duddz and Cecil bonk heads, the frenemies wind up in each other’s bodies.
books.title: FGTEEV: THE SWITCHEROO RESCUE!

books.author: Tatsuya Endo
books.description: A master spy must pass himself off as a family man to infiltrate a private school, but his new wife is an assassin and adopted child is a telepath.
books.title: SPY X FAMILY, VOL. 1

books.description: Charlie and Nick deal with the ups and downs of high school at the same time they grow closer together.
books.title: HEARTSTOPPER, VOL. 1

books.description: The 10th book in the Dog Man series. Can the power of love overcome the darkness and despair created by new villains?

books.author: Dav Pilkey
books.description: Stories within a story come to life as Li'l Petey, Flippy and Molly show baby frogs how to create comics.

books.description: The 11th book in the Baby-sitters Club graphic novel series. The club’s future becomes uncertain as Stacey McGill is about to move back to New York.

books.description: The ninth book in the Dog Man series. After turning in his badge, the canine cop is determined not to just roll over.

books.description: A prequel to the manga series. Yuta Okkotsu enrolls at a school where students learn how to combat curses.

books.description: After tragedy upsets her stable family life, Maggie must decide if she will take a risk with a thrill seeker.
books.title: NINE LIVES

books.author: John Sandford
books.description: The 31st book in the Prey series. When federal officers are killed, Lucas Davenport and Virgil Flowers team up to investigate matters.
books.title: OCEAN PREY

books.author: James Patterson and Chris Tebbetts
books.contributor: by James Patterson and Chris Tebbetts
books.description: After getting kicked out of M.I.T., Angela Hoot interns with the F.B.I. and tracks the murderous siblings known as the Poet and the Engineer.

books.description: A cushy assignment to help the C.I.A. puts Jack Ryan Jr. in the sights of trained killers.

books.author: Nora Roberts
books.description: A child star escapes her abductors, gathers herself in western Ireland and returns to Hollywood.

books.description: The 20th book in the Scot Harvath series. The American spy faces dangers in the Arctic Circle.

books.description: The F.B.I. agent Atlee Pine’s search for her twin sister overlaps with a military investigator’s hunt for someone involved in a global conspiracy.

books.description: The seventh book in the Shadow Riders series. Elie Archambault decides to marry a woman he has never met.

books.description: The second book in the Bridgerton series. Kate Sheffield gets in the way of Anthony Bridgerton's intent to marry.

books.author: Debbie Macomber
books.description: A woman who prides herself on her independence winds up in the care of a kind doctor after having a case of appendicitis.

books.author: William W. Johnstone and J.A. Johnstone

books.description: The fifth book in the Jensen Brand series. A lawyer must live by the law of the gun.
books.title: DARK NIGHT IN BIG ROCK

books.author: Stephen King
books.description: After a devastating phenomenon is delivered via everyone’s cellphone, a graphic artist tries to make his way back to his family.
books.title: CELL

books.author: Lee Child and Andrew Child
books.contributor: by Lee Child and Andrew Child
books.description: The 26th book in the Jack Reacher series. Reacher helps an F.B.I. agent look for her missing brother and takes on a foe named Dendoncker.
books.title: BETTER OFF DEAD

books.author: James Patterson and Maxine Paetro
books.contributor: by James Patterson and Maxine Paetro
books.description: The 20th book in the Women’s Murder Club series. Lindsay Boxer looks into the murders of disreputable people in three separate cities.
